lead_paragraph: It's hard to imagine how George Washington's false teeth could be linked to Africa's largest mask. The answer is that they are both on show in museums that are within walking distance of a new stretch of railway line in London, the Overground East London line. This 14-mile route runs from Dalston Junction in north east London to West Croydon in the south of the city. It is being promoted as the CultureLine (www.cultureline.org.uk), because 10 of London's hidden-gem museums are within walking distance of stations on the route.
snippet: The new Overground East London line is being promoted as the CultureLine, because 10 of London's hidden-gem museums are within walking distance of stations on the route.

headline.main: Museums Part of New Cultural Circuit in London

abstract: The new Overground East London line is being promoted as the CultureLine, because 10 of London's hidden-gem museums are within walking distance of stations on the route.
